meanings.definition: A small, red bean commonly used in Asian cuisine.
meanings.sent1: I cooked a delicious soup with azuki beans for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The azuki beans added a nice touch to the stir-fry dish.
meanings.sent3: Why did the azuki bean refuse to jump into the pot? It was too shy!
meanings.sent4: The azuki beans were like little drops of happiness in the bowl.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant red color of the azuki beans made them stand out in the dish.

meanings.definition: A sweet paste made from azuki beans, often used as a filling in Japanese desserts.
meanings.sent1: The azuki paste inside the mochi was sweet and delicious.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the traditional wagashi with azuki bean filling.
meanings.sent3: Why did the azuki paste go to school? To become a smart cookie!
meanings.sent4: The azuki paste was a burst of flavor in the dessert.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the azuki paste filled the room with sweetness.
